name: redelivery
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of taking goods, letters, parcels, etc. to people's houses or places of work again, for a second, third, etc. time: A fee will be charged if re-delivery is required. He wrote the new postcode on the package and took it away for redelivery. Although it is still early in its rollout of services, the company claims redeliveries of less than one-quarter of one percent.
More examplesFewer examplesCustomers who were out when parcels or recorded mail arrived could arrange a time for re-delivery.I was already scheduled for a redelivery of the dining table.The courier left a note with redelivery options.
